meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.9.3 released!
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x version 3.9.3 has just been released. It fixes quite a few bugs that have been reported by the community.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4 beta 3 released!
meta.summary: The third beta version of Eclipse Vert.x 4.0 highlights many features including (but not limited to) HTTP client request creation, HTTP tunnel improvements, and WebSocket upgrade improvements.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4 beta 1 released!
meta.summary: We are extremely pleased to announce the first 4.0 beta release of Eclipse Vert.x. Highlights of this release are the improved JDBC Client API, event loop affinity, and much more.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.9.4 released!
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x version 3.9.4 has just been released. It fixes quite a few bugs that have been reported by the community.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.8.5
meta.summary: This version is a minor bug fix release addressing issues found in Vert.x 3.8.4. We would like to thank you all for reporting these issues.
